text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Lapland | settlement_type = Region | native_name = Lapin maakunta | native_name_lang = fi | other_name = Lapplands landskap | image_shield = Lapin maakunnan vaakuna.svg | shield_size = 75px | image_map = Lappi in Finland.svg | mapsize = 130px | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Finland | seat_type = Capital | seat = Rovaniemi | leader_party = | leader_title = | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 98984 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 182,514 | population_as_of = 31-12-2013 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = EEST | utc_offset1_DST = +3 | iso_code = FI-10 | blank_name_sec1 = NUTS | blank_info_sec1 = | website = | footnotes = Export Value 4 billion Euros }} Finnish Lapland is the northernmost region of Finland. Before, it was the eastern half of Swedish Lapland. The region to the south is Northern Ostrobothnia. The largest lake in the region is Inarijärvi.Lappi:3:Pohjolan luonto, luonnonvarat ja ihminen, page 112, Finnish The highest place is Halti hill, in the Enontekiö municipality. ==Related pages== * Lapland ==References== ==Other websites== * Lapinliitto website * Researchers pictures from 1882-1884, 1887 and 1889, finnish Category:Lapland
title: Lapland (Finland)
